alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coffee and central Geneva Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Geneva, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Geneva, Enterprise, Hartford, Samson, Coffee Springs, Chancellor, Spears, Kellys Crossroads, Eunola, Sellersville, Lytle, High Bluff, Highfalls, Marl, Dundee, Central City, Geneva Municipal A/P, Cool Springs, Vaughanville and Hendrix Crossroad. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
